duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform qualitative and quantitative testing for the development of sustainable packaging products.
Support innovation project trials in WestRock’s pilot plant and manufacturing facilities.
Conduct processes to evaluate the performance of paperboard-based substrates used in packaging applications.
Provide technical support to other R&D Scientists in packaging testing, analysis, and evaluation.
Operate and calibrate equipment, create prototype materials, and collect, compile, and analyze data.
Participate in planning, performing, analyzing, and documenting testing and pilot trials.
Lead fit-for-use and customer properties requirement testing.
Learn new test methods to expand materials science and technology innovation capabilities.
Work with cross-functional teams on strategic projects for product development.
Provide on-the-road trial and mill activity support.
Report safety concerns to management for continuous improvement.

education_certification.credential: BA/BS in hard sciences (Chemistry, biology, packaging, paper science, or related fields)
